message:
Realtime spelling: Gutter decoration removal, spellchecking without edit (#4648)

* ajax load dictionary data separate from main thread

* update markdown link parsing rule for extended block parameters, disable spellchecking inthat element

* address PR: dictionary load RPC use getHostPageBaseURL

* spell check comments in R files, add Ignore option to context menu, re-enable user dictionary

* fix word under cursor detection for spellchecking context menu

* remove gutter warning symbols for spell check

* doing spelling check lint on freshly opened files

* check that the spellchecker is loaded before running the linting operation

* PR feedback addressed

Merge pull request #4632 from rstudio/feature/gsl-lite-narrow-cast

fix more build warnings on Windows using gsl::narrow_cast

message:
fix more build warnings on Windows using gsl::narrow_cast

On Windows/MSVC we get warnings for implicit casts from size_t to int (and some other potentially lossy casts). In my debug Windows build in Qt Creator, fixing those takes the overall warning count from 270 down to 140. Most of the remainder are in 3rd party code I don't want to touch, or different warnings that need further investigation.

Using narrow_cast<> from the ISO Guidelines Support Library (GSL), via gsl-lite, an offshoot of Microsoft's open-source header-only GSL implementation. Unlike the Microsoft version, this one works with C++11 (Microsoft's requires C++14).

narrow_cast<> better expresses the intent of these casts (namely, "we believe these are safe"). It also has the benefit of being searchable and distinguishes them from other uses of static_cast.

The GSL also has narrow<>, which checks that the cast is safe and throws or terminates if it is not; I didn't use this.

The GSL is related to the ISO's C++ Core Guidelines, see http://isocpp.github.io/CppCoreGuidelines/CppCoreGuidelines.

The Guideline Support Library puts a few other interesting tidbits at our disposal, see: http://isocpp.github.io/CppCoreGuidelines/CppCoreGuidelines#S-gsl

eliminate CMP0077 cmake warning building macOS package

Gets rid of warning when building RStudio package on macOS:
```
CMake Warning (dev) at /usr/local/Cellar/cmake/3.14.0/share/cmake/Modules/CPack.cmake:548 (option):
    Policy CMP0077 is not set: option() honors normal variables.  Run "cmake
    --help-policy CMP0077" for policy details.  Use the cmake_policy command to
   set the policy and suppress this warning.

    For compatibility with older versions of CMake, option is clearing the
    normal variable 'CPACK_BINARY_DRAGNDROP'.
  Call Stack (most recent call first):
    package/osx/CMakeLists.txt:46 (include)
```
